page.title: 19Housing in Middleton
page.content: The civil parish contains 62 dwellings including three council houses, four council flats, a private house and two bungalows. Until the 1950's all the houses except Rock Cottage, two outlying bungalows built between the wars, and Smerill Grange were owned by the Waterhouse family of Middleton Hall, as part of the Middleton Estate. Now the estate owns only 8 cottages. Most dwellings and farms are owner occupied but six are used as holiday homes and let when not required by their owners. Most buildings are of limestone with dressed gritstone door and window surrounds. There are 10 homes in new buildings, 2 in converted barns and 1 in a converted chapel. There are several farm buildings of sheet steel or asbestos.
